cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi NW of the Isle of Youth, or 90 mi SW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southeastern and central Gulf of Mexico and forecast to turn north toward the Louisiana coast, then slowly north-northeast inland toward Mississippi/Tennessee
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast (near Morgan City–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA (Hurricane Watch) and Sabine Pass to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA (Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cameron LA to west of Intracoastal City LA (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coast eastward to the Mississippi/Alabama border, with greatest impacts from Intracoastal City east to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (34–47 kt) with a 1-in-5 chance of reaching 50 kt; hurricane-force winds unlikely but not ruled out if the core shifts west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible from Sabine Pass east to Pecan Island, including the Calcasieu Ship Channel entrance that serves Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, locally higher, bringing risk of flash flooding over Calcasieu and Cameron Parishes.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and dangerous rip currents along the southwest Louisiana shoreline.
